Sentencas: In the present work, anode supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) based on a YSZ single layer electrolyte with locally developed electronic conduction near the anode side is fabricated to improve the cell durability under negative voltage conditions.
Titulo: Locally developed electronic conduction in a yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte for durable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A ceria added Ni/YSZ anode functional layer is utilized and co-sintered with the YSZ electrolyte at 1460 degrees C. Cerium ions are diffused into a limited region of the YSZ layer (-6 mm), establishing a ceria doped YSZ region.
Titulo: Locally developed electronic conduction in a yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte for durable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: We successfully demonstrate that this YSZ single layer cell can operate stably for-100 h without anode/electrolyte interface delamination, even under a negative voltage.
Titulo: Locally developed electronic conduction in a yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte for durable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The embedded probe technique and theoretical calculation reveal that the internal oxygen partial pressure (near the anode) is substantially reduced (stabilized) by means of local electronic conduction of ceria doped YSZ.
Titulo: Locally developed electronic conduction in a yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte for durable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thus, we propose an SOFC electrolyte design comprising a YSZ single layer with a ceria added anode functional layer (locally formed ceria doped YSZ in the electrolyte) as a protection method against fuel cell stack degradation caused by negative voltage operation.
Titulo: Locally developed electronic conduction in a yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte for durable solid oxide fuel cells
